BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

Items.Title: Oversight - Expanding NYC Human Rights law Employment Protections Against Workforce Discrimination.
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Expanding NYC Human Rights law Employment Protections Against Workforce Discrimination.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring employers to hold an onboarding meeting to discuss an employee's reintegration back into the workplace after parental leave
Items.MatterName: Requiring employers to hold an onboarding meeting to discuss an employee's reintegration back into the workplace after parental leave.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring covered entities to maintain a record of requests from persons requesting a reasonable accommodation
Items.MatterName: Requiring covered entities to maintain a record of requests from persons requesting a reasonable accommodation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to voiding no-rehire provisions in settlement agreements for persons aggrieved by unlawful discriminatory practices
Items.MatterName: Voiding no-rehire provisions in settlement agreements for persons aggrieved by unlawful discriminatory practices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the statute of limitations for commencing a private cause of action under the city human rights law
Items.MatterName: Extending the statute of limitations for commencing a private cause of action under the city human rights law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to forbidding agreements to shorten the period in which claims and complaints of unlawful discriminatory practices, harassment or violence may be filed and in which civil actions may be commenced
Items.MatterName: Forbidding agreements to shorten the period in which claims and complaints of unlawful discriminatory practices, harassment or violence may be filed and in which civil actions may be commenced.
